item.description:
Note that I've updated the start time!

The Harvard Museum of Natural History will screen "Battle to Save the Tiger" (BBC2 Productions, 48 minutes).

Narrated by David Attenborough, this new documentary looks at the controversy surrounding tigers of India's protected reserves and why there are fewer today than when the government launched efforts to protect them 35 years ago.

Following the film, John Linehan, Executive Director of Zoo New England, will address how local zoos are helping combat the exploitation of exotic endangered animals and the illegal pet trade.

After the event we'll meet up and head to The Temple Bar for cocktails & conversation.

Thursday, July 31, From 5:00 to 8:00 pm, half-price admission (Adult $4.50 / Students and Seniors $3.50 / Children $3.00). Cannot be combined with any other offer, discount, or coupon.

~ ~ ~

Further note: In acknowledgement of the life-long work of Ron Thomson in wildlife management & preservation in Africa, I have set up (with his permission) an Honorary Fund in his name at the WWF website:
Ron Thomson Honorary Fund

S.
